transportAdvice: Nuremberg has a well-developed public transit network including a metro (U-Bahn), trams, and buses that connect the city centre with most tourist areas efficiently. The historic old town is compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold winter month with frequent overcast skies, occasional snow, and frosty nights.
Still cold and grey with some snow possible, though days gradually begin to lengthen.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional sunny spells mixed with rain showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees, though showers remain common throughout the month.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it one of the more enjoyable months for outdoor sightseeing.
Warm early summer with longer days, though afternoon thunderstorms are fairly frequent.
The warmest month of the year with plenty of sunshine but also a risk of heavy summer storms.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and occasional thunderstorms; a busy tourist period.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with fewer crowds and a mix of sunny and cloudy days.
Cooler and increasingly grey with autumn foliage adding colour to the city's parks and surroundings.
Cold and often damp with limited daylight; the famous Christmas market opens late in the month.
Cold winter month dominated by the world-renowned Christkindlesmarkt, with possible snow adding festive atmosphere.
